item.text:
Ski Area and Forest Emergency Procedures Act of 2018 or SAFE Act of 2018

This bill requires the Forest Service to provide specified notice before closing a ski area located in a national forest.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 195 (Tuesday, December 11, 2018)][House][Pages H10103-H10104]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TIPTON:H.R. 7263.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H10104]]Artivle IV, Section 3, Clause 2: The Congress shall havePower to dispose of and make all needful Rules andRegulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States.
bill.title: SAFE Act of 2018

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to provide notice in the case of certain ski area closures, and for other purposes.
Ski Area and Forest Emergency Procedures Act of 2018
SAFE Act of 2018

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
